text: Darnella Frazier (born March 23, 2003) is an African-American woman, who won the "2021 Special Citation and Award" from the Pulitzer Prize board. The board stated that she was receiving this award Her prize has sometimes been called "an honorary Pulitzer Prize". In 2020 she got the 2020 PEN/Benenson Courage Award from PEN America. == Early life == Darnella Frazier was born in Saint Paul and grew up there. She went to Roosevelt High School in Minneapolis. She has several siblings. Frazier was a high school junior (or in the 11th grade) at the time of Floyd's murder. == Related pages == *Murder of George Floyd ==References== Category:Living people Category:People from Saint Paul, Minnesota Category:Pulitzer Prize winners
title: Darnella Frazier
